channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15479] No more garbage or beware of autoboxing
item.description: Quick journey with JMC in a profile mode revealed very interesting and unexpected heap polluter on a client side. Patch will shortly follow.
item.summary: No more garbage or beware of autoboxing

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Here is the patch.

The issue.

AsyncProcess.canTakeOperation before patch:


 protected boolean canTakeOperation(HRegionLocation loc,

                                     Map<Long, Boolean> regionsIncluded,

                                     Map<ServerName, Boolean> serversIncluded) {

    long regionId = loc.getRegionInfo().getRegionId();

    Boolean regionPrevious = regionsIncluded.get(regionId);

after patch:


 protected boolean canTakeOperation(HRegionLocation loc,

                                     Map<Long, Boolean> regionsIncluded,

                                     Map<ServerName, Boolean> serversIncluded) {

    Long regionId = loc.getRegionInfo().getRegionId();

    Boolean regionPrevious = regionsIncluded.get(regionId);

The difference? Object allocation on a client side dropped from 120G to 20G in the same test run. The test uses BufferedMutator to send data to HBase.
Forgot to mention, there is a performance boost as well ( around 5%, may be more)
lgtm

Nice finding. HRegionInfo is unfortunately a client-public class, so we cannot do the fix as is in branch-1 code bases. I remember there was a recent issue to fix this particular Map to be not regionId based, but regionName based.
Can we change the Map<Long, Boolean> regionsIncluded map to be Map<HRegionInfo, Boolean> regionsIncluded?

Can we change the Map<Long, Boolean> regionsIncluded map to be Map<HRegionInfo, Boolean> regionsIncluded?

Sure, we can.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.

hbase-server tests were not run.

Can you include some trivial change in hbase-server module so that hbase-server tests are run ?
Ted, what is the point of running server tests?

Some stats number:

Total Object Allocation on a client

Before patch - 186GB
With patch - 95 GB

Not running hbase-server has hidden cost:


Author: Mikhail Antonov <antonov@apache.org>

Date:   Thu Mar 17 01:06:42 2016 -0700



    HBASE-15390 Unnecessary MetaCache evictions cause elevated number of requests to meta (ADDENDUM)

Currently Yetus only runs unit tests in modules which are touched by the patch.

This may lead to regression some cases where bug was detected when running hbase-server module tests.
lgtm.

Enis Soztutar

lgtm

Commit?
Is -v2 complete? I see the signature change for canTakeOperation, but no caller change in the patch.

Yes, it is complete, Lars


-      Map<Long, Boolean> regionIncluded = new HashMap<Long, Boolean>();

+      Map<HRegionInfo, Boolean> regionIncluded = new HashMap<HRegionInfo, Boolean>();



skip



   protected boolean canTakeOperation(HRegionLocation loc,

-                                     Map<Long, Boolean> regionsIncluded,

+                                     Map<HRegionInfo, Boolean> regionsIncluded,

                                      Map<ServerName, Boolean> serversIncluded) {

Ahh... The call is not in the patch but the parameter change is. Cool.

Seems good to commit to all branches.

Seems late to join the discussion... From the commit we have changed the map key from Long to HRegionInfo, and since HRegionLocation will get cached in connection while no more autoboxing for long->Long, the change truly could reduce object allocation. However, it seems to me the compareTo method of HRegionInfo has more cost than Long, so could you also share the performance boost with the latest patch Vladimir Rodionov? Thanks.

... and I was going to say, hoist the improvement as a release note so folks don't have to go hunting down the issue to figure what for benefit (especially given the nice savings). Thanks Vladimir Rodionov

Yu Li

However, it seems to me the compareTo method of HRegionInfo has more cost than Long, so could you also share the performance boost with the latest patch Vladimir Rodionov? Thanks.

Overhead of compareTo is extremely low. I do see performance boost and decreased frequency of GC. Will publish numbers in parent ticket.

Good to know, thanks. Will also check the performance in local if time allows.

btw, it seems no parent ticket for this one, maybe lack of some link here?

btw, it seems no parent ticket for this one, maybe lack of some link here?

HBASE-15492.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: This fix decreases client's memory allocation during writes by more than 50%.
